name: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Cook the spaghetti in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente.
In a separate pan, fry the pancetta with the garlic until the pancetta is crispy.
Beat the eggs in a bowl, then mix with the grated pecorino and parmesan cheese.
Drain the spaghetti and add it to the pancetta. Remove from heat.
Quickly pour the egg and cheese mixture over the pasta, stirring constantly until creamy.
Season with black pepper and serve immediately.

name: Chicken Alfredo
instructions: Cook the fettuccine in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente.
In a pan, melt the butter and cook the minced garlic until fragrant.
Add the heavy cream and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat and stir in the parmesan cheese until the sauce is smooth.
Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then grill or pan-fry until fully cooked. Slice into strips.
Toss the cooked pasta with the Alfredo sauce and top with the sliced chicken.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve.

name: Beef Stew
ingredients: 1 kg beef chuck, cut into cubes
instructions: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Brown the beef cubes on all sides.
Add the onions and garlic, cooking until softened.
Stir in the tomato paste, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Add the beef broth, carrots, and potatoes. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 2 hours, until the beef is tender.
Serve hot.

name: Grilled Salmon
instructions: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Brush the salmon fillets with olive oil and season with salt, pepper, and garlic.
Grill the salmon for about 6-8 minutes on each side, or until cooked through.
Garnish with lemon slices and fresh dill. Serve immediately.

name: BBQ Ribs
instructions: Preheat the oven to 300°F (150°C).
Mix the brown sugar, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Rub the spice mixture all over the ribs.
Wrap the ribs in foil and bake for 2.5 hours.
Unwrap the ribs and brush with BBQ sauce. Grill for an additional 10 minutes, basting with more sauce.
Serve hot.

name: Shrimp Scampi
instructions: Cook the linguine in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente.
In a large pan, heat the olive oil and butter. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant.
Add the shrimp and cook until pink.
Pour in the white wine and lemon juice, bringing to a simmer.
Toss the cooked linguine with the shrimp mixture and season with salt, pepper, and parsley.
Serve immediately.

name: Beef Tacos
instructions: In a large pan, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Cook the ground beef until browned.
Stir in the taco seasoning and cook according to the packet instructions.
Warm the taco shells according to package directions.
Fill each shell with ground beef, lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, and sour cream.
Serve immediately.

name: Roast Chicken
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Rub the chicken with olive oil, garlic, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Place the lemon halves inside the chicken cavity.
Roast the chicken for 1.5 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (75°C).
Garnish with fresh rosemary and serve.

name: Lamb Curry
instructions: In a large pot, heat the oil over medium heat. Cook the onions, garlic, and ginger until soft.
Add the lamb and brown on all sides.
Stir in the curry powder, turmeric, salt, and pepper.
Pour in the coconut milk and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat and cook for 1 hour, until the lamb is tender.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve.

name: Turkey Sandwich
instructions: Spread mayonnaise and mustard on the bread slices.
Layer the turkey, cheese, lettuce, and tomato between the bread slices.
Serve immediately.
